适合和朋友一起玩的一款游戏
如果你是一个人玩的话，玩逃生者你可能会被屠夫和队友搞心态
逃生者不建议去日服单排玩，日服屠夫喜爱守尸，队友喜欢蹲蘑菇
玩屠夫的话，你很可能会被车队溜，四个打击，两个手电筒两把钥匙，玩屠夫遇到车队就得脏一点
前期针对小守尸，红苹果改了后更加难针对车队了，屠夫推荐军团，乐趣性高

玩这个游戏认识了不少小姐姐  和 妹妹，她们好像不喜欢别的游戏，到挺喜欢这种恐怖点的游戏的
我玩这游戏断断续续的，经常几个月不上线，改版也一般不太关注，不过最近和生化危机合作了，蛮感兴趣的。

游戏还是给个推荐，虽然有些外挂  BUG  但是游戏还是挺欢乐的
偶尔玩玩还是很不错的16年底就买了 每年都会玩一会 还看看拒绝的视频

Came back to this game after not playing for over a year.
I had absolutely no trouble going against low and high level killers alike. I can see why so few people play killer. If you're survivor you win, end of story. Many killers got reworks, which isn't necessarily a bad idea, but a lot of the killer meta perks got reworked or nerfed. Meanwhile a large amount of survivor perks have gotten changed and buffed. 
The game is also getting to the point where it feels oversaturated with too many characters and too many perks. 

TLDR: The game is hideously unbalanced and biased towards survivors. Additionally it suffers from oversaturation and can be confusing for new players or returning veterans.

AYUDA NO PUEDO PARA DE JUGAR, ajasj la verdad que si este juego es un vicio, si bien tiene sus pequeñas cosas malas, hits muy falsos, cosas muy ops, etc. Pero es un juegaso y la cantidad de horas que podes perder aca es increíble, lo que mas te hace jugar es el rank, uf ese rank la ambición de llegar a rangos rojos, aprender a jugar mejor es una muy linda experiencia.

Es muchisimo mas divertido si se juega con amigos, las risas/cagasos que te llevas son muy buenos. Despues la comunidad en si tiene su parte toxica, si bien no jugue tanto como para estar totalmente seguro, en lo que vengo jugando que es poco mas de un mes no llegue a ver demasiada toxicidad, eso es un punto a favor.

 Sin duda muy recomendado, vale totalmente el precio.

+291 hours update:
Since matchmaking, rating, and ranks were all revised a few months ago the matches have _usually_ been more even.  Other than the occasional one where a new survivor gets thrown into a higher-rated mix.  If you play during an event that draws more players in, you'll have much better matches. 
 Halloween, Christmas, maybe even bonus bloodpoint periods all come to mind.
Since the rank revision, ranks have become far less meaningful.  You still won't see complete beginners up at the top ranks ("red ranks").  But your rank "ratchets" each time it goes up (it takes multiple pips to rank-up).  So once you're reached a certain rank, it won't go down again until the monthly reset on the 13th.  At which point you're rewarded bloodpoints based on the rank you reached since the last reset.
So, while ranks aren't as indicative of skill now, personally I find the game much more enjoyable.  No more getting _close_ to the old "gold" rank, then getting utterly stomped by high-skill players.  Nor does losing a match or few feel as punishing.  Since you can lose pips, but not ranks.  This also makes it that much easier to be merciful to players having a hard time in a given match.
Plus, accounts now have per-killer matchmaking ratings.  So if you're good on one and bad at another (even though you like playing the one you're bad at), you'll still get appropriate matches for each once that killer's rating levels itself out.  Instead of feeling constantly pressured to only play the killers you're good with to avoid awful-feeling matches with one you'd rather play, but can't compete at the same level with.
There's still the occasional match that'll feel bad, as with any competitive game.  There's still rude players, but I haven't personally encountered nearly as many as I used to.  You'll still occasionally get camping killers, but those matches will either go quick or help ensure the other survivors can escape.
All-in-all, the recent rework has let me enjoy the game more consistently.  👍

Original review:
This is less of a "no" and more of a "it depends".  If you play survivors with friends: sure.  If you play a game with five total people, all your friends: absolutely.  If you want to play killer: beware.
The game starts everyone at rank 20 (you have a killer rank and a survivor rank).  As you progress, you reach rank 1.  Ranks reset on the 13th of every month.  These days, there are too few rank 10-1 killers playing.  So, if you play killer around rank 13-10 or so, sure your queue will put you into a match pretty much immediately.  Unfortunately, what that means is you just got matched with four people, 2-4 of which will be ranks 1-4 who were waiting forever for a killer to play against, and they're just going to taunt, annoy, bully, trash talk, blind, body-block, and generally remove the entire feeling of fun from the game.  Save yourself the heartache if you want to play killer and you're not truly top-tier.  Because otherwise you'll just be getting stomped all over by horrible human beings one match after another.

The survivors were the real monsters all along.

168 hours on record. If I had to guess I'd say about 90 of those hours are queue times. Long queue times are not a bad thing by default...but when the rank differences between players is so different, (Level 18 survivors vs red and purple rank killers.),then you start to wonder why it took so long to find a match.
Gameplay is solid, few bugs here and there but nothing horrible.
